Mechanosensation.notes: As sponges, Tetillidae likely possess mechanosensory abilities to detect water currents and particle movement for filter feeding. This is a common trait in sponges.

Chemoreception.notes: Likely possess chemoreception for detecting dissolved organic matter and other chemical cues related to feeding and environmental conditions. This is a common trait in sponges.

Photosensitivity.notes: Photosensitivity is not well-documented in sponges, although some species may harbor symbiotic algae. Its prevalence within Tetillidae is unknown.
